children.name: snatch x
children.definition: snatch đoạn
examples: a short part of something
i tried to hear what they were saying, but i only managed to catch a few snatchesofconversation.
verb + snatch
sing a snatch

children.name: a part of an object / substance/area
part
children.definition: /pɑːʳt/ phần
examples: ▪ when you have filled in the form, keep the top part and send the other part to the bank.
▪ all our replacement parts are guaranteed, if you have your car serviced with us each year.
part of
phần của
▪ what part of russia are you from?
▪ this is the widest part of the river.
▪ malaria is still common in many parts of africa.

children.name: bit
children.definition: /bɪt/  especially british,spokenasmallpart of anobjectorarea:
examples: mảnh, miếng, mẩu
▪ ‘would you like a slice of cake?’ ‘i’ll just have a little bit, please.’
bit of
mảnh, miếng, mẩu của
▪ the bit of the garden where the fruit trees are
▪ i found some bits of glass in my sandwich.

children.name: piece
children.definition: /piːs/  one of severaldifferentpartsthat must bejoined togetherto make something:
examples: mảnh, miếng, khúc, viên, cục...
▪ a 1000-piece jigsaw puzzlein pieces as separate pieces
▪ the equipment had to be taken apart and transported in pieces.

children.name: section
children.definition: /ˈsekʃən/  a part of something that is clearlydifferentandseparatefrom the other parts:
examples: phần,đoạn, khúc ( đã tách ra )
section of
phần,đoạn, khúc ( đã tách ra ) của
▪ the final section of this chapter will deal with recent developments.
▪ first class seats are in the front section of the plane.
▪ the disease spread through the poorer sections of the city.

children.name: component
children.definition: /kəmˈpəʊnənt/  one of the separate parts of a machine or a system, that is necessary to make the machine or system work:thành phần
examples: ▪ the factory makes aircraft engine components.
▪ all the components should be tested before they are assembled.
component of:
thành phần của
▪ gaining confidence is a major component of developing leadership skills.

children.name: constituent
children.definition: /kənˈstɪtʃuənt/  formal one of the chemical substances that something is made of:phần tử, thành phần
examples: ▪ scientists have to break the compound down into its constituents in order to analyze it.
constituent of
phần tử, thành phần của
▪ magnesium and sodium are the main constituents of salt.

children.name: portion
children.definition: /ˈpɔːʳʃən/  a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts - used especially in a technical context:phần, phần chia
examples: ▪ fuel is carried in the lower portion of the rocket.
portion of
phần, phần chia của
▪ surgeons have had to remove portions of his stomach and intestine.
▪ the research suggests we only use a small portion of our brains at any one time.

children.name: segment
children.definition: /ˈsegmənt/  a part of something such as a fruit, insect etc that is naturally divided, or a part of something that has been divided into separate, roughly equal parts:đoạn, khúc, đốt, miếng
examples: ▪ decorate the cake with orange segments.
▪ an ant’s body is divided into three distinct segments.
segment of
▪ each sales team targets its efforts at a particular segment of the general population.

children.name: part of a story, book, film etc
part a1
children.definition: part/pɑːʳt/
examples: ▪ jane austen’s ‘pride and prejudice’, adapted for radio in six parts
part of
▪ i’ve finished the first part of my thesis.
part about
▪ did you understand the part about switching the modem speed?
part one/part 2 etcone of the main parts that a book, tv story etc is divided into
▪ part one ends with the death of the hero’s father.

children.name: bit
children.definition: /bɪt/  british spoken a small part of a story or film:
examples: ▪ my favourite bit is when they try to escape.
bit of
▪ some bits of the book are actually quite funny.

children.name: chapter b1
children.definition: chapter/ˈtʃæptəʳ/  one of the parts that a book is divided into:
examples: chương
▪ these matters are dealt with in chapters 8 & 9.
▪ ‘have you finished ‘lord of the rings’ yet?’ ‘i’m on the last chapter.’

children.name: scene
children.definition: /siːn/  one of the smaller parts of aplay orfilmin which the same characters appear or the events happen in the same place:
examples: cảnh
▪ the sex scenes between depardieu and brochet are sensitively filmed.
▪ the ghost appears in act 2, scene 1.
opening/closing scenethe first or the last scene
▪ the opening scene of the movie features the gangsters discussing their next heist.

children.name: extract
children.definition: /ˈekstrækt/  a part taken from something such as a book or a speech in order to show its most important points or to show what the whole of it is like:đoạn trích
examples: ▪ in the following extract, jones presents the arguments in favour of nuclear power.
extract from
đoạn trích từ
▪ the book contains previously unpublished material, including extracts from diaries, letters and taped interviews.

children.name: excerpt
children.definition: /ˈeksɜːʳpt/  a short part taken from a film, book, speech, piece of music etc:phần trích, đoạn trích
examples: excerpt from
phần trích, đoạn trích từ
▪ i’d like to read out a short excerpt from the poem.
▪ the following excerpt is from one of my students’ essays.
▪ he played some excerpts from grieg’s piano concerto.

children.name: clip
children.definition: /klɪp/  a short part of a film or other recording that is taken and used in another film or in a television programme:đoạn phim
examples: ▪ the police have released a video clip of the attack.
▪ the new software makes it possible to cut and paste sound or video clips from one application to another.
clip from
đoạn phim từ
▪ i saw a clip from the new michael douglas movie on tv last night.

children.name: episode b2
children.definition: episode/ˈepɪsəʊd, ˈepəsəʊd/  a part of a story on radio or television that is told in separate parts, usually weekly:đoạn, hồi, tình tiết
examples: ▪ that was one of the best episodes - i wish i’d got it on tape.
▪ brad pitt made a guest appearance on last week’s episode.
▪ ernie directed all 12 of the half-hour episodes for television.
episode of
đoạn, hồi, tình tiết của
▪ i’ve never even seen an episode of star trek

children.name: instalment x
children.definition: instalmentbritish /installment american /ɪnˈstɔːlmənt/  part of a story that is told in several parts printed regularly in a magazine or newspaper over a period of time:phần đăng
examples: ▪ oliver stone was in thailand shooting the final instalment in his vietnam trilogy, heaven and earth.
weekly/monthly instalments
phần đăng hàng tuần/hàng tháng
▪ dickens wrote his novels in weekly instalments for a magazine.
instalment of
phần đăng của
▪ we are proud to present the second instalment of our fantastic six-part competition to win a renault clio.

children.name: one of the two areas on either side of sth
side a2
children.definition: side one of the two areas that are on the left or the right of an imaginary line, or on the left or the right of a border, wall, river etc : bên, phía, phần
examples: side of
the south side of town is pretty run down.
on the ... side
a scar on the right side of his face
fuel is cheaper on the french side of the border.
to one/the side
she tilted her head to one side, pretending to consider the question.
one sidea path leads down one side of the garden to a paved area.
the other/opposite sideon the other side of the river are some low hills.
either side(= both sides )there were tall hedges on either side of the lawn.
the far side(= the other side, quite a long way away )nicolo was standing on the far side of the room.
the left/right sidehe received a deep cut on the right side of his face.
the left-hand/right-hand sideon the left-hand side list the skills and qualifications required for the job.
the east/west etc sidethe shop was on the west side of culver street.

children.name: end a2
children.definition: end the part of a place or object that is furthest from its beginning or centre
examples: end of
we sat atopposite endsof the table.
he wore spectacles perched onthe very endof his nose.
the end of the pencil snapped.
jo joined the end of the line.
the far end(= furthest from you )of the room
the channel measures 20 feetfrom end to end.
he cut a thick slice from the end of the loaf.
at one end of sth
mrs deacon sat at one end of the long table and i sat at the other.
at both ends
there are scoreboards at both ends of the stadium.
at each end
a boy was carrying a stick across his shoulders with a pail of water at each end.
stand/place something on end(= in an upright position )
he stood the box on end to open it.
lay/place something end to end(= in a line, with the ends touching )
bricks laid end to end

children.name: branch
children.definition: /brɑːntʃǁbræntʃ/  a shop, office, or bank in a particular area that is part of a larger organization:
examples: chi nhánh
▪ our store has branches all over the country.
▪ i’m sorry, we can’t change foreign currency. we’re only a small branch, you see.
branch of
chi nhánh của
▪ you can deposit money at any branch of the northwest pacific bank.

children.name: department
children.definition: /dɪˈpɑːʳtmənt/  a department of a large organization, such as a company, school, or hospital, is a part of it that is responsible for a particular kind of work:
examples: bộ phận, ban
▪ our department deals mainly with exports.
▪ which department do you work in?
sales/accounts/planning etc departmentin a company or large organization
bộ phận kinh doanh/ kế toán / kế hoạch vv
▪ melissa is in charge of the marketing department.
art/history/science etc departmentin a school or university
bộ nghệ thuật / lịch sử / khoa học vv
▪ she works in the humanities department
the department of science/english/trade etcin a school or university, or other large organization, especially a government
bộ khoa học / tiếng anh / thương mại vv
▪ the department of trade and industry
▪ the department of experimental psychology

children.name: division
children.definition: /dɪˈvɪʒən, dəˈvɪʒən/  a large part of an organization, especially a company, which often includes several smaller parts:phân khu, khu vực
examples: ▪ the sales and advertising departments are both part of the marketing division.
▪ i work in the administration division as a mail mover.
division of
phân khu, khu vực của
▪ the japanese division of american express

children.name: section
children.definition: /ˈsekʃən/  a part of an organization, especially a part of a company or a political group, that is responsible for a special area of its work:bộ phận
examples: ▪ the party’s young conservatives section is growing fast.
▪ the tutor asked the brass section to play their piece again.
section of
bộ phận của
▪ we had to go to the ‘late payments’ section of the financial aid office.

children.name: sector
children.definition: /ˈsektəʳ/  a part of an area of economic activity, such as industry or trade:khu vực
examples: manufacturing/business/retail etc sector
khu vực sản xuất/kinh doanh/bán lẻ...
▪ the growth in the number of home computers has boosted the electronics sector.
▪ the new sales tax caused problems for the retail sector the shops and stores that sell goods to the public.
public sector
khu vực công cộng
organizations that the government owns
▪ the main source of work here is public sector employment.
private/independent sector
khu vực tư nhân
organizations that the government does not own
▪ private sector pay increases were again above the rate of inflation.

children.name: wing
children.definition: /wɪŋ/  a part of a political party or a similar organization that has different ideas from the rest of the party, or is involved in different activities:cánh
examples: right/left wing
cánh hữu/tả
▪ the racist right wing staged their biggest demonstration yet in the main square.
political/military wing
phe cánh chính trị/quân sự
▪ the tamil tigers have had a political wing since 1976, but never registered it as a legal party.
wing of
phe cánh của
▪ they were members of the marxist wing of the socialist party.

children.name: the ... side
children.definition: /ðə ... saɪd/  informal
examples: đội
the financial/business/marketing etc side
đội tài chính/kinh doanh/tiếp thị...
a particular part of an organization’s activity:
▪ i’m in charge of production, and martha takes care of the financial side.

children.name: to be a part of sth
be part of
children.definition: /biː ˈpɑːʳt ɒv/ là một phần của
examples: ▪ falling over is part of the process of learning to ski.
▪ it is part of the doctor’s job to give advice on emotional problems.
▪ restrictions on foreign trade are part of the state’s economic and legal system.

children.name: form (a) part of
children.definition: /ˌfɔːʳm (ə) ˈpɑːʳt ɒv/  to be one of the things that together make up something larger or more important:là (một) phần của
examples: ▪ group discussion forms a major part of classwork.
▪ the company forms part of the united holdings group.
▪ these three books form part of a series on religion in the modern world.

children.name: inherent
children.definition: /ɪnˈhɪərənt, -ˈher-/  an inherent fact, problem, quality etc is one that is a natural part of an activity or situation and cannot be separated from it:vốn gắn liền với
examples: ▪ money is unfortunately an inherent part of politics.
inherent in
▪ surgical procedures have many risks inherent in them.
▪ the uncertainties that are inherent in the research and development process
inherently[adverb]
▪ is mankind an inherently violent species?

children.name: part of a situation/ subject/ sb’s character
aspect
children.definition: /ˈæspekt/  one of the many parts of a situation or subject, which can each be considered separately:
examples: khía cạnh, mặt
▪ the inspectors will examine health and safety aspects at the plant.
aspect of
khía cạnh, mặt của
▪ chris is dealing with the commercial aspects of this ambitious project.
▪ the country was on the brink of war, and fear and uncertainty permeated every aspect of daily life.

children.name: side
children.definition: /saɪd/  one part of a situation or someone’s character - use this especially when you arecomparingone part with another:
examples: mặt
▪ weiskopf was a talented and successful man, but he did have a cruel side.
side of
mặt của
▪ i’d like to move away from the theory now, to concentrate on the practical side of engineering.
the negative/positive/lighter/funny side
mặt tiêu cực/tích cực/sáng sủa hơn/khôi hài
▪ you are enthusiastic, but on the negative side, you can be impatient and critical.
▪ try to see the funny side of the situation.
▪ the lighter side of the conference, as seen by our political cartoonist

children.name: dimension
children.definition: /daɪˈmenʃən, d-/  a part of a situation that makes you look at the situation in a particular way:chiều hướng, khía cạnh
examples: ▪ the arrival of the south african team has brought a new dimension to the competition.
dimension of
chiều hướng, khía cạnh của
▪ the political dimensions of the incident are clear.
▪ a revival of interest in the spiritual and moral dimensions of life
the human dimension
khía cạnh nhân văn
making you think of people’s feelings, rather than things
▪ the new art gallery is impressive, but i felt the human dimension had been lost.

children.name: factor
children.definition: /ˈfæktəʳ/  one of the parts or features of a situation, each of which has a different effect or importance:nhân tố
examples: ▪ there are one or two factors we haven’t considered yet.
▪ the issue of abortion rights is obviously not the only factor affecting the female vote.
▪ traders said several factors contributed to nasdaq’s weakness.
factor in
nhân tố trong
▪ the most important factor in professional sport is psychology.
▪ his formal education was a less significant factor in his upbringing than practical experience.

children.name: element
children.definition: /ˈelɪmənt, ˈeləmənt/  one of the separate parts of something such as a person’s character, a system or process, or a piece of writing:yếu tố, nguyên tố
examples: ▪ the planning proposals have three main elements.
element of
yếu tố, nguyên tố của
▪ there’s always been an element of competition between me and my brother.
element in
yếu tố, nguyên tố trong
▪ instead of a single plot, there are several elements in the story.
▪ we’ve reached the stage where public image is the most important element in the presidency.
key element most important element
yếu tố, nguyên tố chính
▪ i see helping the community as one of the key elements of my work.

children.name: feature
children.definition: /ˈfiːtʃəʳ/  a part of something that is different in some way from the rest of it:nét đặc biệt, điểm đặc trưng
examples: ▪ are there any special features about the way ireland trains its teachers?
feature of
nét đặc biệt, điểm đặc trưng của
▪ federalism remains a very important feature of american politics.
▪ one of the features of auto-immune diseases is that they are often genetically similar.

children.name: one of the parts of a process
part
children.definition: /pɑːʳt/
examples: phần
▪ organizing the party was easy, the hardest part was getting my parents to agree to it.
part of
phần của
▪ which part of your job do you enjoy most?
▪ she spent the early part of her life in barcelona.
▪ part of the research program involved interviewing teenagers in inner-city areas.

children.name: bit
children.definition: /bɪt/  british spoken a part of an activity, plan, or job:phần nhỏ
examples: ▪ alan did the easy bit -- it was me who did all the hard work!
bit of
phần nhỏ của
▪ i’ll probably do a bit of gardening this weekend.

children.name: stage
children.definition: /steɪdʒ/  one of several parts of a long process, which happen one after another:giai đoạn
examples: ▪ dan has never gone through a rebellious stage.
stage of
giai đoạn của
▪ many women feel depressed during the early stages of pregnancy.
stage in
giai đoạn trong
▪ we saw a video showing the second stage in the development of a human embryo.at this stage now
▪ at this stage of the election campaign, it is impossible to say who will win.
reach/be at/get to the stage
vươn tới giai đoạn
to be at a particular part of a process
▪ we reached the stage where we’d given up any hopes of seeing our daughter alive.
▪ ‘how’s your dissertation coming on?’ ‘i’m at the writing-up stage.’

children.name: step
children.definition: /step/  one of the parts of a process that you have to do or deal with in order to go on to the next one:bước
examples: ▪ the next step will be to make the pasta sauce.
▪ the first step towards achieving peace in the region will be to elect a government that represents all the people.
one step at a time
từng bước một
used to say that you should deal with one part of a process thoroughly before worrying about the next one
▪ the doctors say i’ll make a full recovery, but i’m going to have to take it one step at a time.

children.name: phase
children.definition: /feɪz/  a separate part in the development or growth of something:giai đoạn, thời kỳ
examples: ▪ i’d like to discuss the production phase at this morning’s meeting.
phase in
▪ there are three phases in the lifecycle of a butterfly.
initial/primary/first phase
giai đoạn, thời kỳ đầu
the first part
▪ the initial phase of the project should take about three months.
final/last phase the last part
giai đoạn, thời kỳ cuối
▪ as the war enters its final phase, the un will probably consider lifting sanctions.
